name: The Tower at Turning Stone Resort

reviews.text: We visited in late September with Family. Had some free rooms from a family member that had some gambling comps.
reviews.title: Stay at the newer Lodge if you can

reviews.text: The hotel room was dated, but you can't really avoid that unless they undergo a massive remodeling. I'm always disappointed when rooms don't include a fridge, but we did get one for a nominal $5 charge. Internet was free. But the room just seemed small. I can't say that it is any smaller than the typical budget room, but we felt cramped and it could have been cleaner. I also find it incredibly hard to believe that they had no rooms available with the lock-off door so we could have been closer to our family, but ... the room was a comp, so ... what can you do.
reviews.title: Lord of the Flies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In contrast, we had a room about 18 months ago in the newer tower, and that room was FANTASTIC. Go check that out if you have a choice. You won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised.

reviews.text: Buffet is one of the best I've been to outside of the Vegas strip, the casino is large and I enjoyed it, the rewards program in the casino seems to be excellent, and they have some nice coffee/dessert shops. Valet was slow, as others have mentioned.
reviews.title: Best Four Diamond Resort in NY State!

reviews.text: All in all, I'd go back - but would only stay in the new section. The older rooms are just a big turn-off to me.
reviews.title: Beware Bed Bugs. Please take notice!

reviews.text: My husband recently attended at the Turning Stone and I tagged along. We both enjoyed the accommodations. Very clean and very comfy. We arrived late, ordered room services. Food was good, but had to wait quite a while for its arrival. My husband liked the conference rooms and was impressed with attention to room temp, etc. Meals were good, as well. We had dinner together at the Brazilian restaurant. Food was good there as well. I enjoyed the pool, shopping and the sweets and coffee at Opal's. I tried to gamble, but I am a hopeless...I just don't have the attention span. The other reviews are spot on with the smoking. Whether you are in the non-smoking section, or the smoking section, there really isn't much difference. I could only stand it for an hour and then I found other things to do. All in all, a very nice stay. We would visit the Turning Stone again.
reviews.title: Nice place. Love to Visit.

reviews.text: Note: This review is for a room at The Hotel at Turning Stone. The Hotel is different than The Tower although it is part of the same building complex. The Hotel at Turning Stone is not listed by TripAdvisor.
reviews.title: Good choice for a casino hotel

reviews.text: HITS
reviews.title: Nice Place but don't expect any compensation if you get sick from their food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Room looked recently renovated
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: - King room had desk with chair, club chair with ottoman, two occasional chairs with table
reviews.title: Nice rooms, modern bathrooms, clean, smoky casino.

reviews.text: My company had an event and convention here back in January and its definitely a great spot for this. The event rooms were spacious, food was good, drinks were plenty. The staff was excellent as well!
reviews.title: Great place for a Convention

reviews.text: Rooms at the tower were very clean, bed comfortable and good sized bathroom with nice toiletries.
reviews.title: A wonderful value

reviews.text: Of course a trip to the casino is always a plus as well.
reviews.title: Great Stay on a Snowy Weekend

reviews.text: Highly recommended for a group event!
reviews.title: Four Stars Elude Turning Stone: Smoke and Skana Spa are Issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped in w/o reservations (right off highway) had a choice of 4 price ranges. As our teenage son was with us we opted for a suite in the tower, only $40 more a night and it had a separate sitting room with a pullout couch and tv. This was great for the teenager to stay up later and not disturb the parents. The hotel was extremely clean and the employees were kind and helpful. We ate at the buffet for dinner and breakfast, what a great value for lots of food choices. We will definitely be going back. i am very fussy and I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We did not gamble but enjoyed the ambiance.
reviews.title: Amazing Stay

reviews.text: Stayed for a family wedding. This place pretends to be high-end but is not even close. The room was nicely done but there were way too many negatives, especially given the price. The lobby, common areas and restaurants stink from smoke and you must rush to the elevator to avoid this.There is nowhere you can go in the hotel besides your room if you don't want to smell smoke. Water pressure was terrible in our rooms including toilet and shower and we were told there was nothing they could do about it, something with the pump. Light bulb was burned out in bathroom. Maid service was totally unacceptable- room had not been made up all day and when we called and said we would be leaving again in 20 minutes they came and tried to clean while we were still there getting ready. The pool and gym require a $10 fee per use. They call it a resort but there is nothing to do if you don't gamble or play golf. The staff outside the hotel are so busy trying to take your car to valet that they didn't listen if we were trying to drop someone off or pick up. Overly pushy and annoying. We would have preferred to stay at the inn down the road for less $, and without the smoke.
reviews.title: avoid this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stay at Turning Stone several times a year. We love the resort- especially the Towers. The rooms are very modern and trendy- very clean. The bathrooms are beautiful and spa-like. Huge showers with great water pressure! We're always pleased with our rooms. Take advantage of the spa services at the hotel...they are wonderful. The "Total Relaxation Therapy" massage is the best! The golfing is excellent- definitely the best in the area. Our favorite restaurants are Peach Blossom and Rodizio. They serve Starbucks coffee in the hotel too- added bonus! The lobby is very inviting and warm with a huge fireplace. Make sure to grab a canoli before you leave- they are fresh every day! The gambling is good...though the minimums at tables on weekends could be better. Turning Stone usually brings in really good concerts and shows so we enjoy coming back time and time again. The night club Lava is very nice - there is a dress code. The grounds are kept immaculate. We really enjoy our time at Turning Stone and will return again soon!!
reviews.title: Nice resort- great rooms!

reviews.text: Stayed here for a convention my partner had to attend. Room was on 7th floor, nicely appointed have stayed in similar style rooms in a new Holiday Inn Express. Not sure of cost as this was company paid. Beds were on soft side. Only 1 hook in bathroom to hang towels, which I thought was odd. Bathroom was very modern though, big shower with duel shower heads. Very odd that there were no outlets to plug computer into on desk, others said they had a lamp with outlet but this wasn't the case in our room. Luckily our neighbors were quiet, as the walls are pretty thin, could here alarms and cell phones going off. Getting to the room is odd, as you need to use your room key to activate elevator, I appreciate the security, but it was a pain when you were carrying something.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, bring lots of money!

reviews.text: Got one of the best massages ever at the spa, so do recommend it if you get a chance.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return!

reviews.text: Not a gambler so didn't spend too much time in there. Restaurants are WAY over-priced. $30 for an average steak, PLUS $6 to get a baked potato?? Come on, why don't you just shake me down at the door! Also went to the Rodizio, a brazilian type place with different meats brought to your table. No one at our table was impressed with it.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel experience

aka: The Tower At Turning Stone Hotel Verona
